title: Exhausted Ukrainian Troops Wait For Trump While Struggling To Hold Kursk
content: The soldiers are encumbered with fatigue and strained with sleeplessness because of terrifying 3,000 kg glide bombs. And now, as the winter stings, the only silver lining they can see amidst the grey - Donald Trump's inauguration.
summary: The soldiers are encumbered with fatigue and strained with sleeplessness because of terrifying 3,000 kg glide bombs. And now, as the winter stings, the only silver lining they can see amidst the grey - Donald Trump's inauguration.

title: Generative AI Had Muted Impact On Global Polls This Year: Meta
content: Despite widespread concern that generative AI could interfere with major elections around the globe this year, the technology had limited impact across Meta Platforms' apps, the tech company said on Tuesday.
summary: Despite widespread concern that generative AI could interfere with major elections around the globe this year, the technology had limited impact across Meta Platforms' apps, the tech company said on Tuesday.

title: Netanyahu Thanks Trump For 'Strong' Statement On Gaza Hostages
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanked Donald Trump Tuesday for a social media post in which the US president-elect called for hostages held in Gaza to be released by his first day in office.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanked Donald Trump Tuesday for a social media post in which the US president-elect called for hostages held in Gaza to be released by his first day in office.

title: Putin-Controlled Aircraft Deported 314 Ukrainian Children: Report
content: Russian presidential aircraft and funds were used in a program that took children from occupied Ukrainian territories, stripped them of Ukrainian identity and placed them with Russian families, according to a report by Yale's School of Public Health.
summary: Russian presidential aircraft and funds were used in a program that took children from occupied Ukrainian territories, stripped them of Ukrainian identity and placed them with Russian families, according to a report by Yale's School of Public Health.

title: Indian-Origin Man In Singapore Speaks Up After Video Of Fight Goes Viral
content: An Indian-origin man who was recently involved in a confrontation with several people in a lift lobby in Singapore has come forward to share his side of the story.
summary: An Indian-origin man who was recently involved in a confrontation with several people in a lift lobby in Singapore has come forward to share his side of the story.

title: Live Updates: South Korea Under Martial Law. What's Next
content: It is the first time since 1980 that South Korea has declared martial law and while it has been considered authoritarian in the past, it's been democratic since. He cited the decision as necessary and to protect constitutional order and freedom.
summary: It is the first time since 1980 that South Korea has declared martial law and while it has been considered authoritarian in the past, it's been democratic since. He cited the decision as necessary and to protect constitutional order and freedom.

title: South Korea Under Martial Law. Here's What It Means For Its Citizens
content: For the first time in nearly half a century, South Korea has declared martial law across the nation. In a sudden announcement shortly after 10 pm local time, President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law from 11 pm the same evening.
summary: For the first time in nearly half a century, South Korea has declared martial law across the nation. In a sudden announcement shortly after 10 pm local time, President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law from 11 pm the same evening.

title: Woman Arrested In Hit-And-Run Death Of Indian Student In Connecticut
content: A 41-year-old woman has been arrested in the hit-and-run death of an Indian student in Connecticut last year.
summary: A 41-year-old woman has been arrested in the hit-and-run death of an Indian student in Connecticut last year.

title: China Bans Minerals Export Needed For Semiconductors Amid Trade War With US
content: China has banned exports to the United States of items related to the minerals gallium, germanium and antimony that have potential military applications, it said on Tuesday, a day after Washington's latest crackdown on China's chip sector.
summary: China has banned exports to the United States of items related to the minerals gallium, germanium and antimony that have potential military applications, it said on Tuesday, a day after Washington's latest crackdown on China's chip sector.

title: Indian Man Survives Car Crash In US, Thanks Apple Watch For Quick Response
content: Indian entrepreneur Kuldeep Dhankar recently shared how he survived a car crash with the help of his Apple Watch.
summary: Indian entrepreneur Kuldeep Dhankar recently shared how he survived a car crash with the help of his Apple Watch.

title: French Far-Right's Le Pen May Regret Her Risky Bid To Topple Government
content: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen appears to be betting her future on ousting President Emmanuel Macron before his term ends in 2027, lawmakers and analysts say. To do so, she has helped trigger France's second political crisis in six months.
summary: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen appears to be betting her future on ousting President Emmanuel Macron before his term ends in 2027, lawmakers and analysts say. To do so, she has helped trigger France's second political crisis in six months.

title: Missing Hannah Kobayashi Seen Crossing Into Mexico Voluntarily: US Police
content: New video evidence shows Kobayashi entering Mexico on foot at the San Ysidro port of entry on November 12th.
summary: New video evidence shows Kobayashi entering Mexico on foot at the San Ysidro port of entry on November 12th.

title: Saudi Arabia Executed Over 300 People In 2024 So Far: Report
content: Saudi Arabia has executed more than 300 people this year, a record tally based on official figures, after state media said four more people were put to death on Tuesday.
summary: Saudi Arabia has executed more than 300 people this year, a record tally based on official figures, after state media said four more people were put to death on Tuesday.

title: US Woman Jailed For Killing, Eating Cat: "You've Embarrassed This Nation"
content: A 27-year-old woman in the US who killed and ate a cat has been sentenced to one year in jail after a furious judge slammed her for the stomach-turning act.
summary: A 27-year-old woman in the US who killed and ate a cat has been sentenced to one year in jail after a furious judge slammed her for the stomach-turning act.

title: 100-Year-Old Ex-Nazi Camp Guard May Face Trial In Germany
content: German authorities are pressing for a 100-year-old former Nazi concentration camp guard to face trial almost 80 years since the end of World War II.
summary: German authorities are pressing for a 100-year-old former Nazi concentration camp guard to face trial almost 80 years since the end of World War II.

title: South Korea Declares Emergency, Cites Anti-State Element, Communist Threats
content: South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol on Tuesday declared emergency martial law, saying the step was necessary to protect the country from "communist forces" amid parliamentary wrangling over a budget bill.
summary: South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol on Tuesday declared emergency martial law, saying the step was necessary to protect the country from "communist forces" amid parliamentary wrangling over a budget bill.

title: Hours After Closing Visa Office In Tripura, Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy
content: Bangladesh today summoned India's envoy to Dhaka, hours after closing its visa and consular office in Tripura after a security incident yesterday.
summary: Bangladesh today summoned India's envoy to Dhaka, hours after closing its visa and consular office in Tripura after a security incident yesterday.

title: How Beijing Reduced Air Pollution By Up To 89% In A Decade
content: Despite a tripling of vehicle numbers, pollution levels have decreased, making Beijing a model for other cities tackling similar problems.

title: Spain Records Warmest November In Over 60 Years After Devastating Floods
content: Spain has registered its warmest November since record-keeping began more than six decades ago, even after October ended with its worst floods in a generation, official data showed Tuesday.
summary: Spain has registered its warmest November since record-keeping began more than six decades ago, even after October ended with its worst floods in a generation, official data showed Tuesday.
